item.title: Best Battlefield 6 Keybinds - Keyboard And Mouse Settings
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Keyboard and mouse are extremely popular inputs for Battlefield 6 players. While most players still play the game on a controller, thanks to the console versions, many fans have swapped to a keyboard and mouse due to how difficult it can be to nail down the best controller settings in Battlefield 6.

If you've made the switch to keyboard and mouse (KBM) or have been using KBM for ages, you'll need the best settings for your devices. Getting your keybinds, sensitivities, and other settings tuned just right can lead to a more enjoyable gameplay experience and often makes the difference between life and death on the battlefield.

Below, you'll find the optimal setting for every keyboard and mouse menu option in Battlefield 6.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • Best settings for keyboard and mouse in Battlefield 6
    • Infantry Control Settings
    • Infantry Keybinds
    • Vehicles
    • Vehicles Control Settings

Best settings for keyboard and mouse in Battlefield 6

First off, you can find your keyboard and mouse settings by pressing the cog icon at the top-right of the Battlefield 6 main menu. Here, navigate to the tab labeled "Mouse & Keyboard" and select it to find all sorts of different options to view and change.

The keyboard and mouse settings in Battlefield 6 are split up into multiple sections and menus, and it can be difficult to go through every available setting. Fortunately, all you have to do is read below to find the section you want to change and all of the settings that go with that section in Battlefield 6.

Infantry Control Settings

Aim

  • Infantry Mouse Aim Sensitivity: 40-50
  • Uniform Infantry Aiming: On
  • Zoom Sensitivity Coefficient: 178
  • Infantry Zoom Aim Sensitivity: 80-90
  • Vertical Mouse Aim Ratio: 100
  • Invert Vertical Look - Infantry: Off
  • Field of View: 105

Movement

  • Infantry Sprint: Click
  • Double Tap Forward Sprint: Off
  • Sprint: Left Shift
  • Crouch Toggle Sprint: Stand
  • Vault Over Sprint: On
  • Slide: N/A
  • Crouch Slide: All
  • Double Tap Crouch For Sprint Slide: Off
  • Landing Roll: On

Zoom

  • Infantry Weapon Zoom: Hold
  • Zoom: Right Mouse Button
  • Steady Scope: Hold
  • Steady Scope: Left Shirt
  • Infantry Zoom Aim Sensitivity: 80-90
  • Vertical Mouse Aim Ratio: 100

Other

  • Parachute Auto Deploy: Insertions Only
  • Interact & Reload: Prioritize Reload
  • Skip Revive: Hold
  • Request Revive: Toggle
  • Invert Demolition Charge: Off
  • Mount Breakout: Instant
  • Mount Presets: Combo
  • Peek Type: Side and Up
  • Mount Type: Side and Up
  • Interacts: Off

Infantry Keybinds

General

  • Interact: E
  • Enter / Exit Vehicle: E
  • Big Map: M
  • Quick Loadout Customization: Y
  • Toggle Inventory/Scoreboard: Tab
  • Change Seat in Vehicle: F
  • Skip to Deploy: Space
  • Ping / CommoRose (Hold) / Call-in Gadget Half Combo: Left Alt

Movement & Aiming

  • Walk Forward: W
  • Walk Backward: S
  • Strafe Right: D
  • Strafe Left: A
  • Look Up: Mouse Forward
  • Look Down: Mouse Backward
  • Look Right: Mouse Right
  • Look Left: Mouse Left
  • Jump: Space
  • Vault: Space
  • Sprint: Left Shift
  • Crouch (Hold): C
  • Crouch (Toggle): Left Ctrl
  • Prone: Z
  • Parachute Deploy: Space
  • Slide: N/A
  • Lean/Peek: N/A

Weapons & Equipment

  • Fire: Left Mouse Button
  • Zoom: Right Mouse Button
  • Reload: R
  • Melee/Takedown: F
  • Primary Weapon: 1
  • Secondary Weapon: 2
  • Gadget One: 3
  • Gadget Two: 4
  • Weapon Inspect: I
  • Squad Progression/Class Gadget: X
  • Grenade: G
  • Contextual Action: 5
  • Toggle Laser And/or Flashlight: T
  • Fire Mode/Zeroing /Ranger Finder Zeroing: B
  • Steady Scope: Left Shift
  • Toggle Scope: V
  • Cycle Primary Weapon: Mouse Wheel Up
  • Cycle Secondary Weapon: Mouse Wheel Down
  • Deploy Bipod/Mount: F

Vehicles

  • Vehicle Mouse Aim Sensitivity: 40

Vehicles Control Settings

  • Invert Vertical Flight - Aircraft - Off
  • Invert Vertical Look - Aircraft: Off
  • Air Control Sensitivity: 40-50
  • Helicopter Control Sensitivity: 40-50
  • Helicopter Control Assists: Off
  • Third Person Aircraft Camera Roll: On
  • Vehicle Boost: Toggle
  • Vehicle Weapon Zoom: Hold

And that takes care of every pertinent keyboard and mouse setting you'll need in Battlefield 6. We ommitted some of the non-important settings and all of the UI keybinds, as those are generally left perfectly fine on their default options. However, you can always head back into the settings if you find you want to change something on that front. We also recommend to try our settings and then tinker with them yourself to find the best values for you and your preferences.

For more Battlefield 6 guides, make sure to check out our full guides hub for the game, which includes everything you need to know about EA's new hit shooter.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/best-battlefield-6-keybinds-keyboard-and-mouse-settings/1100-6535380/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: B2G1 Free Nintendo Books, Movies, And Cartoons At Amazon
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Nintendo fans can save big on official strategy guides, art and lore books, manga, sticker books, and more thanks to Amazon's Buy Two, Get One Free Sale. That said, this promotion only runs through October 11, so you don't have much time to secure books based on your favorite Nintendo games and franchises, including The Legend of Zelda, Super Mario, Pokemon, and Kirby.

Notably, the promotion has Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom and Breath of the Wild hardcover strategy guides as well as Dark Horse's premium art and lore books: Hyrule Historia, Arts & Artifacts, and The Art of Super Mario Odyssey. You'll also find the official graphic novel for A Link to the Past and Legendary Editions of the Ocarina of Time and Oracle of Ages/Seasons manga.

Amazon's B2G1 Free Sale is a mix-and-match promotion, so you can pair books with movies and TV series. The catalog includes Pokemon anime, Super Mario cartoons, and 4K Blu-ray editions of Detective Pikachu and The Super Mario Bros. Movie.

We found a bunch of Nintendo books, movies, and animated series that are eligible for Amazon's promotion. To make it easy to shop, we created hub pages on Amazon with all of the eligible products we saw. Check them out at the links below:

B2G1 Free Official Nintendo Books, Movies, and TV

  • The Legend of Zelda B2G1 Free Books
  • Super Mario B2G1 Free Books
  • Super Mario B2G1 Free Cartoons
  • Pokemon B2G1 Free Books
  • Pokemon B2G1 Free Anime
  • Kirby B2G1 Free Books
  • Lexar 512GB And 1TB MicroSD Express For Switch 2 Get Massive Discounts
  • Get Super Mario And Kirby Switch 2 Wireless Controllers For Up To 50% Off
  • Audible Premium Plus Holiday Deal: Get 3 Audiobooks For $3
  • + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5)
  • Grab 4K Blu-Rays For Under $13: Inception, The Shining, Blade Runner, And More
  • ROG Xbox Ally X Preorders In Stock At Best Buy, Sold Out Everywhere Else (September 27)
  • New Magic: The Gathering Final Fantasy Chocobo Bundle & Scene Boxes Up For Preorder
  • You Can Get The $60 Lego Game Boy Early From Amazon
  • Complete History Of Middle-Earth Collector's Box Set Restocked With $170 Discount

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

Latest in The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/buy-two-get-one-free-legend-of-zelda-super-mario-pokemon-kirby-books-and-blu-rays/1100-6535381/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Battlefield 6 - All Campaign Collectibles And How To Find Them
item.content:encoded:
Battlefield 6 includes a full campaign, and there are plenty of collectibles to find throughout the missions. The game includes 30 dog tags and one toy T-Rex dinosaur to locate, which are all required if you're hoping to earn all of the achievements/trophies in Battlefield 6. Additionally, there are some decent cosmetic rewards you can earn by finding all the dog tags in the campaign.

Below you'll find our full guide to walk you through finding all the collectibles hidden in Battlefield 6's campaign. If you're looking for how long the story will take to complete, all the Battlefield 6 missions and details can be found here.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • Always Faithful ( 1 dino + 3 dog tags)
  • The Rock (3 dog tags)
  • Operation Gladius (3 dog tags)
  • Night Raid (4 dog tags)
  • No Sleep (3 dog tags)
  • Moving Mountains (4 dog tags)
  • Nile Guard (2 dog tags)
  • Operation Ember Strike (4 dog tags)
  • Always Forward (4 dog tags)

Dino - (This for the achievement/trophy called "End of an Era") As soon as you get control of your character at the start of the mission, turn around to find the T-Rex dinosaur figure on the table behind you. Interact with the dino for the achievement.

#1 - The first dog tag comes after you exit the tank and head toward the rendezvous point with the sniper squad. As you head up to meet the snipers, look left and the tag is on a crate near the ammo resupply.

#2 - When planting the second C4 charge, go left into the room and you'll find the dog tag hanging from the back of a support column with a knife and poster.

#3 - Once you reach the rooftop, the last dog tag is found near the edge with an orange drink cooler.

#1 - As soon as you land and get control of your character, turn around and move behind you and to the right to find a dog tag on a small blue crate.

#2 - While following Carter through the tunnels of Gibraltar, you'll pass within an underground WWII museum. Pass through the first section of WWII memorabilia, and there will be a scene of an officer sitting at a desk on your left. The dog tag is sitting on the desk.

#3 - The final tag is found after you exit the tunnels. It's found when assisting with the AAA gun at Anne's Battery. Proceed down the stairs towards the area, and the dog tag is hanging inside a shipping container full of gear.

#1 - After you clear out your first section of enemies on foot, you'll be tasked with escorting a tank uphill toward City Hall. There is a dog tag just to the left of the tank. It's on top of a crate with some other items. Be careful not to get too close to the tank or it will advance your checkpoint and the tag will become out of bounds.

#2 - Outside on the back balcony area of the buildings you clear on your route toward city hall. This is found after your objective becomes "reach the overwatch position." This is found on the left hand side of the street shortly before reaching city hall. It's on a table with a book.

#3 - This dog tag is found just inside City Hall. As soon as you enter, check the first room on the left hand side of the lower floor. The dog tag is hanging from a knife stabbed through a poster.

#1 - The first tag isn't found until you enter the palace after turning off the power. It's in one of the smaller rooms upstairs hanging from a covered mirror or painting on the wall. This can be collected before or after the objective to breach the door, so if you accidentally miss it, you can grab it on your way out for the escape.

#2 - Near where you're tasked with locating the rendezvous point. This comes after a lot of firefights with Pax, and you'll finally regroup as a squad in a dark and open area. There's a mural with some paint cans nearby. The dog tag is with the paint cans.

#3 - A helicopter will pursue you. After it disappears and you move through a building with your squad to proceed, you want to check a clothing shop on your left before entering the plaza. The dog tag is on a stand with other items.

#4 - You'll find the final tag when you enter the room with the RPGs and you're tasked with taking down the helicopter. The dog tag is hanging from a knife stuck in a Pax poster.

#1 - Found at the start of the mission when you attend Acre's briefing. During the briefing, turn your back to Acre and look at the wall. There's a dog tag sitting on the table across from him.

2# - During the part where you clear the Pax HQ. Check the HQ after the cutscene, and you'll find a dog tag hanging from a knife sticking out of a corkboard or some kind of wooden board.

#3 - The last tag for the level is found directly after the chase scene ends, and you're on foot again. You'll see a tunnel in front of you, and there's a large shipping container with supplies on your right. Go through the shipping container to find the dog tag on the right.

#1 - Inside the firehouse. You'll find the dog tag upstairs on the kitchen counter.

#2 - When you're tasked with locating the drone command center, you'll pass through a park playground. After clearing out those enemies, you'll approach a small trailer with some construction equipment out front. The tag is on the floor of the trailer by the L-shaped desk.

#3 - When moving through the subway tunnels, you'll find the third tag when the level opens up to the larger part of the subway station. The tag is sitting just below the maps/directory. It's with a green bag and a plushie.

#4 - The final tag is found just after exiting the tunnel. When running to secure the Fulton FOB, veer right and go into the park area across the road. There is a dead soldier on the ground with the final tags of the level.

#1 - Once you exit the tank and proceed on foot with the troops, you'll exit the main street via a small building with PC monitors. Once you exit the back of this building, look right and it's down on the ground by a tree.

#2 - Right after you collect the first tag for the mission, you'll proceed into an open courtyard with your troops. It's in one of the rooms on the left side of the courtyard. It's hanging from a knife that's sticking out of a Pax poster.

#1 - The first tag is found near the start of the mission. When you get on the 4-wheeler to explore the valley, drive straight down toward a small cluster of old buildings. Head into the broken building straight in front of you to retrieve the dog tag on the floor by the rug. If you've reached the Old Fort objective point, you've gone too far.

#2 - Pushing up the center of the valley, you'll pass through a small village and then cross a river. As soon as you cross the river, you'll see a set of three buildings just up the hill. Head inside the center building, and you'll find the dog tag sitting on a crate right underneath the window.

#3 - The third tag is found on the road to Datalink Delta. You can reach it just after checking on Lopez. It's up on the ridge not far from where the sniper was. Don't proceed to the switchblade as ordered, and go up to the ridge behind the blue port-a-potties. The tag is on a military crate.

#4 - After you take out the Delta SAM, you'll regroup with the squad and get some dialogue. Once you regain control of your character, head up the hill and look on the left side of the road. There's a dog tag sitting on a crate.

#1 - Found near the start of the mission at the large white and blue warehouse that you clear out when tasked with getting through the outpost. It's on the ground with some gear near one of the large trucks inside.

#2 - When tasked with disabling NXC Alpha, you'll find it outside the third building you cross through before following the troops along the road. It's just out the backside and on your right. It's sitting on a ledge near some sandbags and gear.

#3 - When you enter the first bunker to disable a NXC launcher, go all the way to the back of the bunker to find the dog tags sitting on a large crate with a helmet and gear pouches.

#4 - In the bunker where you retreat and are tasked to find Kincaid. As soon as you get control of your character after brief dialogue, you'll find the mission's last dog tag on a crate with a laptop and a helmet.



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/battlefield-6-all-campaign-collectibles-and-how-to-find-them/1100-6535383/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
